summary: Multi-page website with sequential navigation; Page 1 is an illustrated garden scene with an interactive letter that opens with a smooth animation to reveal a birthday message and includes a button to proceed to the next page; Page 2 contains a birthday-themed customized message and a next button leading to a subsequent page featuring a magician spell effect that transitions to a full black screen with white text showing a provided birthday poem/message and dropping tulip emojis (replacing the prior 'Error 404' popup).

Implement click/tap interaction on the letter element with a smooth open animation before revealing message content.
Add Page 2 as a birthday-themed message page with a next button continuing the sequential flow.
Replace Page 3 reveal: after spell effect, transition to a full black screen with white text showing the provided message and animate dropping tulip emojis (instead of an 'Error 404' popup).

existing_features.title: Create a multi-page React app where pages are revealed sequentially via explicit user actions (button presses/clicks), starting with Page 1 and a placeholder Page 2 route that can be navigated to from Page 1.

Implement Page 1 as an illustrated garden scene background featuring greenery, a large tree, and a boy sitting under the tree writing a letter. Show an on-screen prompt instructing the user to press/click the letter.
On Page 1, make the letter interactive: when pressed/clicked, animate the letter opening with a smooth, visually pleasing transition and reveal the provided message text inside the opened letter.
Add a 'Next page' button on the opened letter that navigates to Page 2 when pressed/clicked.

Apply a coherent, creative visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) that fits a warm, storybook/garden vibe, and use it consistently across Page 1 and Page 2 (avoid default browser styling).

Generate and include the required static image assets in the frontend under frontend/public/assets/generated, and wire them into Page 1 so the background and letter visuals render from those local static assets (no backend image serving).

Update Page 2 (route "/page2") to display the provided birthday-themed customized message (exact text as provided by the user) in a styled card/layout consistent with the existing warm storybook theme, and include a clearly labeled ‚ÄúNext‚Äù button to proceed to the next page.

Implement sequential navigation gating for the new flow by setting a sessionStorage flag when the user clicks the ‚ÄúNext‚Äù button on Page 2 (e.g., "visited-page2" = "true"), and require that flag on the next page so it cannot be accessed directly without going through Page 2.
